segment.source: Get the tools needed to customize Windows IoT Core
segment.target: Get the tools needed to customize Windows IoT Core

segment.source: Get the tools needed to customize Windows IoT Core
segment.target: Get the tools needed to customize Windows IoT Core

segment.source: Here's the software you'll need to create OEM images using the Windows 10 IoT Core (IoT Core) ADK Add-Ons:
segment.target: Here's the software you'll need to create OEM images using the Windows 10 IoT Core (IoT Core) ADK Add-Ons:

segment.source: PCs and devices
segment.target: PCs and devices

segment.source: Here's how we'll refer to them:
segment.target: Here's how we'll refer to them:

segment.source: Technician PC: Your work PC.
segment.target: Technician PC: Your work PC.

segment.source: This PC should have at least 15GB of free space for installing the software and for modifying IoT Core images.
segment.target: This PC should have at least 15GB of free space for installing the software and for modifying IoT Core images.

segment.source: We recommend either Windows 10 or Windows 8.1 with the latest updates.
segment.target: We recommend either Windows 10 or Windows 8.1 with the latest updates.

segment.source: The minimum requirement is Windows 7 SP1, though this may require additional tools or workarounds for tasks such as mounting .ISO images.
segment.target: The minimum requirement is Windows 7 SP1, though this may require additional tools or workarounds for tasks such as mounting .ISO images.

segment.source: IoT device: A test device or board that represents all of the devices in a single model line.
segment.target: IoT device: A test device or board that represents all of the devices in a single model line.

segment.source: For our examples, you'll need a MinnowBoard Max or Raspberry Pi 2.
segment.target: For our examples, you'll need a MinnowBoard Max or Raspberry Pi 2.

segment.source: These guides do not include sample files for the Qualcomm Dragonboard or the Raspberry Pi 3.
segment.target: These guides do not include sample files for the Qualcomm Dragonboard or the Raspberry Pi 3.

segment.source: To learn more, see Windows compatible hardware development boards.
segment.target: To learn more, see Windows compatible hardware development boards.

segment.source: An HDMI cable, and a monitor or TV with a dedicated HDMI input.
segment.target: An HDMI cable, and a monitor or TV with a dedicated HDMI input.

segment.source: We'll use this to verify that the image is loaded and that our sample apps are running.
segment.target: We'll use this to verify that the image is loaded and that our sample apps are running.

segment.source: Storage
segment.target: Storage

segment.source: A Micro SD card.
segment.target: A Micro SD card.

segment.source: (Note, we just use this for our guide.
segment.target: (Note, we just use this for our guide.

segment.source: You can build devices with other drives.
segment.target: You can build devices with other drives.

segment.source: Learn more about existing supported storage options.)
segment.target: Learn more about existing supported storage options.)

segment.source: If your technician PC doesn't include a Micro SD slot, you may also need an adapter.
segment.target: If your technician PC doesn't include a Micro SD slot, you may also need an adapter.

segment.source: Software
segment.target: Software

segment.source: Install the following tools on your technician PC
segment.target: Install the following tools on your technician PC

segment.source: Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) including at least the Deployment Tools and Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) features.
segment.target: Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) including at least the Deployment Tools and Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) features.

segment.source: You'll use these tools to create images and provisioning packages.
segment.target: You'll use these tools to create images and provisioning packages.

segment.source: Windows Driver Kit (WDK)
segment.target: Windows Driver Kit (WDK)

segment.source: IoT Core .iso package from MSDN Subscriber Downloads The .iso package adds the IoT Core packages and feature manifests used to create IoT Core images.
segment.target: IoT Core .iso package from MSDN Subscriber Downloads The .iso package adds the IoT Core packages and feature manifests used to create IoT Core images.

segment.source: To get these files, you'll need an MSDN subscription or an account as a registered Microsoft OEM.
segment.target: To get these files, you'll need an MSDN subscription or an account as a registered Microsoft OEM.

segment.source: By default, these packages are installed to C:Program Files (x86)Windows Kits10MSPackagesRetail.
segment.target: By default, these packages are installed to C:Program Files (x86)Windows Kits10MSPackagesRetail.

segment.source: IoT Core ADK Add-Ons Download the ZIP file on this page, and extract it to a folder, for example, C:IoT-ADK-AddonKit.
segment.target: IoT Core ADK Add-Ons Download the ZIP file on this page, and extract it to a folder, for example, C:IoT-ADK-AddonKit.

segment.source: This kit includes the sample scripts and base structures you'll use to create your image.
segment.target: This kit includes the sample scripts and base structures you'll use to create your image.

segment.source: (Want more detail?
segment.target: (Want more detail?

segment.source: See What's in the Windows ADK IoT Core Add-ons).
segment.target: See What's in the Windows ADK IoT Core Add-ons).

segment.source: Windows 10 IoT Core Dashboard
segment.target: Windows 10 IoT Core Dashboard

segment.source: Other helpful software:
segment.target: Other helpful software:

segment.source: A text editor such as Notepad++.
segment.target: A text editor such as Notepad++.

segment.source: You can also use the Notepad tool, though for some files, you won't see the line breaks unless you open each file as a UTF-8 file.
segment.target: You can also use the Notepad tool, though for some files, you won't see the line breaks unless you open each file as a UTF-8 file.

segment.source: A compression program such as 7-Zip, which can uncompress Windows app packages.
segment.target: A compression program such as 7-Zip, which can uncompress Windows app packages.

segment.source: Other software
segment.target: Other software

segment.source: An app built for IoT Core.
segment.target: An app built for IoT Core.

segment.source: Our samples use the Hello, World!
segment.target: Our samples use the Hello, World!

segment.source: app, though you can use your own.
segment.target: app, though you can use your own.

segment.source: A driver built for IoT Core.
segment.target: A driver built for IoT Core.

segment.source: Our samples use the Hello, Blinky driver, though you can use your own.
segment.target: Our samples use the Hello, Blinky driver, though you can use your own.

segment.target: Next steps

segment.target: Lab 1a: Create a basic image
